meanings.definition: To loosen or undo the laces of (a shoe or garment).
meanings.sent1: She was unlacing her shoes before entering the house.
meanings.sent2: He carefully unlaced his sneakers after a long day.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy kept unlacing everyone's shoes in the hallway.
meanings.sent4: As the magician performed his trick, it felt like he was unlacing reality itself.
meanings.sent5: The gentle breeze seemed to be unlacing the petals of the flower, one by one.

meanings.definition: To remove or untie the laces of (something).
meanings.sent1: After the game, she quickly unlaced her skates to rest her feet.
meanings.sent2: The child struggled to unlacing the knot in his shoelaces.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel seemed to enjoy unlacing the decorations on the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a way of unlacing the tightly wound emotions within him.
meanings.sent5: The old book was so fragile that merely unlacing it could cause it to fall apart.

meanings.definition: The act of loosening or undoing laces.
meanings.sent1: His quick unlacing of the boots showed his experience in the field.
meanings.sent2: The sound of unlacing echoed through the quiet room.
meanings.sent3: The unlacing of the corset was a relief after a long evening.
meanings.sent4: The unlacing of the sails signaled the end of the sailing trip.
meanings.sent5: The unlacing of the package revealed a surprise gift inside.
